READ THE TAGS!!! People are reviewing this, talking about how it shrinks. That's because they're washing it like any other pair of pants. The tag says "Dry Clean Only." You can get away with a gentle wash, use cold water. Hang-dry it and whenever you want to wear it, put it in the dryer on low for about 10 minutes.

Like that it is a cotton product rather than synthetic plasticy material.  Wicks away sweat well, thick and durable.  Biggest negative of real cotton is that it shrinks significantly in hot water.  Wish sizes were preshrunk but they are not.  May pay to err on the larger size in sizing.  If too big, just wash in warmer water;)

Bought these for working/fishing/boating to keep my 75 year old pasty white legs out of the sun.  Perfect.  Light but heavy enough for their actual intended use of painting/ drywall/ carpentry, etc.  True to size with a little stretch.  Wore while hanging a half dozen security cams.  Tool loops were handy and went up & down ladder with no crotch or knee binding. So good for work or play, but not for the prom.

That said , I keep ordering new pairs ( 2 sizes to big , just to maximize any value for my dollar). Nearly a disposable product. But the cheapest brand out there.

评论概述: Great pants for women who wear this style (and you should!)
评论详情: These pants are fantastic; they are the perfect casual pants to knock around in, and if you have good styling skills, you can make them work for pretty much anything but a wedding or a funeral.  I have an average thin build, some curves, but not "curvy." Five foot five, 125 lbs, my Dickies men's size is 32 x 30 (same as for 874s, but that's a different review). These fit super loose (too loose to wear) when unpacked, I washed and dried them twice in hot water, and high heat, and they shrunk to the perfect fit. I cuff them once.  I get compliments on them all the time, and I wear them all the time. It's the best thirty-bucks you will ever spend, I have Banana Republic trousers in my closet at $150 that I pass over in lieu of these. I got the natural color (they are not "yellow" as some reviews have said). The fabric has a nice drape, but is thick enough to not be see through. I almost don't want to tell people about these pants in case they become more known an the price goes up. lol.  PS On these and my other Dickies, they are much improved by getting a ripper and taking the Dickies tag off of them. Sorry, Dickies, I'd rather people wonder where I got such cool pants.
they fit well and rugged

评论概述: Great Pants, But Sizing is Off
评论详情: These are definitely a high quality pant. But the sizing is way off. In almost every other brand I’m a 34 waist. There was no way I could button these they were so small even though I bought 34s and they say relaxed fit. If you’re going to buy these, order up like two or even four inches on the waist than you normally would.

I really like these pants. The fabric is a nice light to mid weight natural cotton. I ordered these because I really like the dickies painter pants and I was looking for something similar but a bit more relaxed.  I sized up to 32 from 30 and I think it was the right decision; maybe 31 would have been the best but these definite do fit a bit smaller after the wash.  There are a decent amount of loose threads, but it's no big deal on a pair of pants for less than 30 bucks.
Used by someone who paints homes for a living; perfect for that use; easy to wash and fits as expected

Make and material very good. I ordered in the “natural” color. I’m hard to fit and was a 32” waist pre-pandemic and Carhartt discontinued the carpenter pant I’ve been wearing for years so ordered a 32” Dickies that was too small so it lingered in the closet since 2020. I finally broke down a few weeks ago and ordered a 33” which was “large” right out of the package and was confident the new Dickies would fit. I washed them twice (it was stiff with “sizing” from the factory) and tried them on and was happy. However, I made the mistake of wearing them on a long flight and realized it was still too small after shrinking. I’ll have to buy a 34” waist….. I’ll end up with 3 pairs at that point; a too tight 32”, a seemingly snug fit 33” that I could wear as long as it’s not worn on a long airline flight or hours long car cruise, and perhaps a “loose fit” 34” needing a belt….. I don’t know, we’ll see. I really like wear these for all purpose, leisure to work around the house. The clock is ticking on my old Carhartt before they start to wear out…..
